data.title: Gonzalo Higuain, Kyle Scott, Gary Cahill and the 9 players released by Chelsea
data.meta_description: Players contracts officially ran out on June 30th
data.text:
Sunday June 30 was the last day when some players could officially say that they played for Chelsea.

While the retained list had been published for most clubs, the players who were not being offered a renewed contract were still officially Chelsea players until 11:59pm yesterday.

From today they are free agents and able to sign for other clubs. Some will already have their future sorted, while others will be assessing their options ahead of the new season.

The Blues squad will return for pre-season over the next couple of weeks.

But who has said their goodbyes at Stamford Bridge and what lies in store for them in the future? Take a look below to find out...

Gary Cahill

The club captain has been at Chelsea since January 2012, when he joined from Bolton Wanderers. But the former England defender has found game time hard to come by over the last season, making just two league appearances. The 33-year-old has recently been linked with a shock switch to Arsenal, but is yet to reveal where he will play his football next season.

Bradley Collins

The 22-year-old goalkeeper spent the 2018/19 season on loan at League One club Burton Albion, where he played a total of 35 games, keeping 12 clean sheets.

The Chelsea academy graduate will join Barnsley on the expiry of his contract.

Eduardo

Another goalkeeper who is leaving Stamford Bridge this summer, the 36-year-old joined Chelsea from Dinamo Zagreb in August 2016, but spent last season on loan at Vitesse Arnhem.

The Portuguese goalkeeper has already arranged a move back to his home country by joining SC Braga for the upcoming season.

Rob Green

The third goalkeeper who is leaving the club following the expiry of his contract. The former England man joined Chelsea on a free transfer last summer, but failed to make an appearance for the club.

The 39-year-old has announced his retirement from football, having made a total of 636 career appearances.

Todd Kane

The 25-year-old right back has had his fair share of loans away from Stamford Bridge. Most recently he was at Hull City, where he made 41 appearances last season.

He has been linked with a move to Derby County, but Frank Lampard's imminent departure to Chelsea could make it an interesting summer for the full-back.

Josimar Quintero

Quintero was another one of Chelsea's loan army to play his football away from the Blues last season. The 22-year-old found himself at Spanish third tier side Lleida Esportiu where he played just 16 league games.

He is yet to sort his future after being included on the released list.

Ruben Sammut

Midfielder Sammut spent the first half of the season in the Scottish Championship playing for Falkirk FC, but returned to Chelsea in January 2019.

The 21-year-old has been linked to Sunderland.

Kyle Scott

The midfielder spent the first half of the 2018/19 season on loan at Dutch second division side SC Telstar, but returned to Stamford Bridge in January, having made 14 appearances for the club.

The 21-year-old has made one senior appearance for Chelsea, but will be leaving the club this summer.

MartellTaylor-Crossdale

As somewhat of a rarity for Chelsea, the 19-year-old striker hasn't been on loan during his time at the club. Instead, he mainly played for the U23 side, scoring seven goals in 29 appearances.

JaredThompson

Thompson is another goalkeeper who is leaving Chelsea this season. He spent the latter part of the season on loan at Northern Irish Premier club Warrenpoint Town, where he made five appearances, keeping two clean sheets.

FankatyDabo

The 23-year-old right-back has spent the season on loan at Dutch second division side Sparta Rotterdam., where he played 26 games.

Dabo has already sorted his future away from Stamford Bridge, signing a three-year-deal with League One side Coventry City.

Gonzalo Higuain

Gonzalo Higuain's time at Chelsea has officially come to an end, the club have confirmed.

The Argentinian forward joined the Blues on loan in January, linking up once again with Maurizio Sarri and was expected the rediscover the brilliant form showed at Napoli when the pair last worked together.

But Higuain has failed to replicate that form in west London, scoring five goals in 18 appearances across competitions.

At the time of his signing in January, Juventus confirmed that Chelsea had initially agreed to potentially extend the loan of the Argentine for another 12 months or sign him on a permanent basis.

But they've opted against taking up that option.

A statement on the club's website reads: "Gary Cahill, Gonzalo Higuain, Rob Green, Eduardo and Kyle Scott have now left Chelsea following the end of their contracts yesterday."
